news.title: ‘Numb and in shock’ – Irish mum’s agony after popular entrepreneur Martha Nolan-O’Slatarra’s death on New York yacht
news.summary: The mother of an Irish woman found dead on a yacht in the US has said she is “numb with shock” and struggling to get information about the circumstances.

news.title: ‘An obtrusive feature’ – split decision over unauthorised works carried out at tech tycoon’s €3m mansion
news.summary: An Coimisiún Pleanála has issued a split decision after tech tycoon Mark Roden sought retention for unauthorised building works on his €3m Kildare property.

news.title: New safety rules introduced for checkpoints after death of Garda Kevin Flatley
news.summary: A detailed risk assessment of the location of a speed checkpoint must be now carried out if a garda is to conduct one alone.

news.title: ‘Ireland’s returns are underwhelming’ – savers are getting some of lowest value on deposit accounts in eurozone
news.summary: Savers in this country have been ­getting some of the lowest return in the ­eurozone over the past 10 years.

news.title: ‘We’ll see when Johnny comes back’ – Ireland kicking coach Gareth Steenson unsure about how Sexton’s new role affects his future
news.summary: It was this month last year that Gareth Steenson was announced as part of a new trio of coaches for the Ireland women’s squad alongside Hugh Hogan and Alex Codling.

news.title: Parents of Olympian Annalise Murphy granted leave to take judicial review over order to demolish sheds
news.summary: The parents of Olympic medal-winner Annalise Murphy have won a preliminary court battle in their long-running planning dispute over the unauthorised building of two large sheds, one with a bedroom, on the shores of Lough Ree.

news.title: Is it ever a good idea to work with your spouse? Irish couples on why they decided to separate work and home for the good of their relationships
news.summary: Vogue Williams and her husband Spencer Matthews have become household names in Ireland and the UK. For the past four years, they have kept fans invested with their podcast which lifted the lid on their lives.

news.title: The Indo Daily: How a WhatsApp message told an Irish family that their mother had died by assisted suicide
news.summary: A Cavan-based woman, Maureen Slough, went abroad to die by assisted suicide, and her family only learnt of her death via WhatsApp.

news.title: ‘They have saved me a fortune over the years’ – how to maximise your loyalty points from Tesco, Boots, Revolut and more
news.summary: What is the point of points? Are they an easy way to score a discount on your food shop and unlock advantages that non-collectors can merely dream of? Or are they a pointless vanity project that lets those who opt in feel like members of an exclusive club?

news.title: Oliver Callan: Silly hyphens, vile smells and no oversight – why bonkers bottle-return scheme makes my blood boil
news.summary: Nothing makes me want to go mad as hell quite like Ireland’s Deposit Re-turn nightmare. Even the maddeningly stupid hyphen in “Re-turn” makes my blood dre-am of re-venge.
